answer_html: We say that \(f\) is injective if whenever we have \(f(x) = f(y)\) for \(x,y \in A\) then \(x=y\).
answer_latex:
We say that $f$ is injective if whenever we have $f(x) = f(y)$ for
$x,y \in A$ then $x=y$.
hints_html: An injective function is also called a one to one function.
hints_latex: An injective function is also called a one to one function.
hints_raw: An injective function is also called a one to one function.
question: 1 (e)
sols_html: We say that \(f\) is injective if whenever we have \(f(x) = f(y)\) for \(x,y \in A\) then \(x=y\).
sols_latex:
We say that $f$ is injective if whenever we have $f(x) = f(y)$ for
$x,y \in A$ then $x=y$.
sols_raw: We say that <math> f </math> is injective if whenever we have <math> f(x) = f(y) </math> for <math> x,y \in A </math> then <math> x=y </math>.
statement_html: Define what it means for a function \(f : A \to B\) to be injective.
statement_latex: Define what it means for a function $f : A \to B$ to be injective.
statement_raw: Define what it means for a function <math> f : A \to B </math> to be injective.
